t: Amazon Labor Union - Wikipedia
s: March 22, 2025 - The Amazon Labor Union (ALU) is a labor union specifically for Amazon workers, created on April 20, 2021. On April 1, 2022, the Amazon workers at a warehouse in Staten Island, JFK8, backed by the ALU became the first unionized Amazon workers recognized by the National Labor Relations Board.

t: Amazon and trade unions - Wikipedia
s: 3 weeks ago - The warehouse worker firings led ... Amazon corporate employees. Emily Cunningham and Maren Costa, both user experience designers, were fired for violating internal policies in April 2020, which the NLRB later determined had been unlawful resulting in a board settlement involving back pay and notice-posting around employees' right to organize. t: Staten Island Amazon union clinches historic win | The Hill
s: April 1, 2022 - Workers at one of Amazon’s New York City facilities have voted to be represented by a union, a historic first at the nation’s second largest private employer.
